task.title: Use Direct Attached Storage (JBOD)
task.shortdesc: This topic describes how to configure the DAS-JBOD as the block storage backend provider on the Storage Controller (SC).

taskbody.prereq:
This task assumes the following:
Successful completion of all the install sections prior to this section.
The SC must be installed, registered, and running.
You must execute the steps below as a Eucalyptus administrator.
Direct Attached Storage requires that /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes have enough space for locally cached snapshots.

context.b: To configure DAS-JBOD block storage on the SC

step.cmd: Configure the SC to use the Direct Attached Storage DASManager for storage.
step.info: euctl <partition>.storage.blockstoragemanager=das The output of the command should be similar to: PROPERTY PARTI00.storage.blockstoragemanager das was <unset>

step.cmd: Verify that the property value is now: 'das'
On the CLC, set the DAS device name property. The device name can be either a raw device (/dev/sdX, for example), or the name of an existing Linux LVM volume group.

taskbody.result: Your DAS-JBOD backend is now ready to use with Eucalyptus.
